verses.plain: O LORD God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

tokens.t: O
God, to whom vengeance belongeth; O God, to whom vengeance belongeth, shew thyself.

verses.plain: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

tokens.t: Lift up thyself, thou judge of the earth: render a reward to the proud.

verses.plain: LORD, how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

tokens.t: , how long shall the wicked, how long shall the wicked triumph?

verses.plain: How long shall they utter and speak hard things? and all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

tokens.t: shall they utter
speak hard things?
all the workers of iniquity boast themselves?

verses.plain: They break in pieces thy people, O LORD, and afflict thine heritage.

tokens.t: They break in pieces thy people, O
, and afflict thine heritage.

verses.plain: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

tokens.t: They slay the widow and the stranger, and murder the fatherless.

verses.plain: Yet they say, The LORD shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard it.

tokens.t: Yet they say, The
shall not see, neither shall the God of Jacob regard

verses.plain: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and ye fools, when will ye be wise?

tokens.t: Understand, ye brutish among the people: and
fools, when will ye be wise?

verses.plain: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

tokens.t: He that planted the ear, shall he not hear? he that formed the eye, shall he not see?

verses.plain: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge, shall not he know?

tokens.t: He that chastiseth the heathen, shall not he correct? he that teacheth man knowledge,

verses.plain: The LORD knoweth the thoughts of man, that they are vanity.

tokens.t: The
knoweth the thoughts of man, that they
vanity.

verses.plain: Blessed is the man whom thou chastenest, O LORD, and teachest him out of thy law;

tokens.t: Blessed
the man whom thou chastenest, O
, and teachest him out of thy law;

verses.plain: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

tokens.t: That thou mayest give him rest from the days of adversity, until the pit be digged for the wicked.

verses.plain: For the LORD will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

tokens.t: For the
will not cast off his people, neither will he forsake his inheritance.

verses.plain: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

tokens.t: But judgment shall return unto righteousness: and all the upright in heart shall follow it.

verses.plain: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers? or who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

tokens.t: Who will rise up for me against the evildoers?
who will stand up for me against the workers of iniquity?

verses.plain: Unless the LORD had been my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

tokens.t: Unless the
my help, my soul had almost dwelt in silence.

verses.plain: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O LORD, held me up.

tokens.t: When I said, My foot slippeth; thy mercy, O
, held me up.

verses.plain: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.

tokens.t: In the multitude of my thoughts within me thy comforts delight my soul.

verses.plain: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

tokens.t: Shall the throne of iniquity have fellowship with thee, which frameth mischief by a law?

verses.plain: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

tokens.t: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, and condemn the innocent blood.

verses.plain: But the LORD is my defence; and my God is the rock of my refuge.

tokens.t: But the
is my defence; and my God
the rock of my refuge.

verses.plain: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness; yea, the LORD our God shall cut them off.

tokens.t: And he shall bring upon them their own iniquity, and shall cut them off in their own wickedness;
, the
our God shall cut them off.

footnotes.text: shall follow…: Heb. shall be after it
